template.description: Example of how to get customer access_token and salesforce url, put it on a cache, then read from the cache and call Salesforce API
template.name: Salesforce_template

labels.label: Note: Please create a DistributedMapCacheServer at this level so its visible to the child Process Groups who can use it for caching key/value pairs. Both Process Groups have to be running.
Call SF login API and get access_token and the your customer-specific URL to call Salesforce API's for subsequent CRUD operations

In this Process Group variables, please create these variables and assign them required values: sfdc_client_id sfdc_client_secret sfdc_login_username sfdc_login_password sfdc_token_url
This GenerateFlowFIle will run every 30 minutes and refresh these values. Please never run this GenerateFlowFile every second.
Put instance_url, access_token and sf_id as key/value pairs in cache. Note: You must create a DistributedMapCacheServer first at a level visible to this Process Group.
check response and place customer instance_url, access_token and salesforceID as flowfile attributes

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

labels.label: GenerateFlowFIle has a JSON request to SalesforceAPI. Then we retrieve cached values for instance_url and access_token and utilize them in call to Salesforce API
